CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 9, 1941 pg. 2 reads: "200 Kiddies Play Daily On Bedford Dwellings Playground - With the combined cooperation of the Works Progress Administration and the Pittsburgh Housing Authority, the playground at Bedford Dwellings is gaining a great deal of recognition in Hill area as it is the only immediate facility for the hundreds of children in the Dwellings. At least 200 of these kiddies play here every morning and, under the able direction of Mrs. Anna Rivers, are taught a wide variety of games, Above, left, shows a volleyball game in progress... - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Boys and girls playing volleyball in Bedford Dwellings playground
